data.text:
Hello everyone. I just discovered that there was a third sequel in this series published in ~2011, I am wondering whether anyone has read it and whether it is a worthy follow-on to the original books. Personally, I preferred the second book to the first, but that is, I am sure, a matter of opinion.

Bob

Hello everyone. I just discovered that there was a third sequel in this series published in ~2011, I am wondering whether anyone has read it and whether it is a worthy follow-on to the original books. Personally, I preferred the second book to the first, but that is, I am sure, a matter of opinion.

Bob

I'm intrigued by this but have not heard of a second sequel in this series. I did some Googling but was unable to find a third book, just a lot of talk about a re-make of the George Pal movie that seems to be dead in the water. Do you know the title or author?

Charlie

The title is Terrans On Beta and is available on Amazon - http://www.amazon.com/Terrans-Beta-...eta&qid=1464305671&ref_=sr_1_2&s=books&sr=1-2

It is a bit expensive, as you can see, for a paperback, but there are some used copies for a little less. I would also have to get After Worlds Collide to refresh my memory.

Bob

Thanks, Bob. Pretty poor reviews so I think I'll pass. Shame though, the story description sounds like it could have been interesting in the proper author's hands. Interesting, the Amazon listing implies it is based on a story draft written by one of the original co-authors of the first two novels.

Charlie

Sorry, everyone. I was just getting my hopes up, I guess. I assumed that Philip Wylie was still alive (instead of dying in 1971) and thought that he directed the book. However, it seems that the actual author, Helms, did a piss poor job of constructing a 'sequel' to the classic books.

However, If anyone comes a 3rd book in the Hiero series (also left with a cliffhanger, of sorts), I would appreciate knowing about that. I kept expecting Lanier to finish the series, but he died on me too.

Bob
